Platform.Title: Sigma Genosys Panorama Escherichia coli Gene Array
Platform.Description: The Panorama Escherichia coli Gene Array was developed using E. coli ORFmers (PCR primers). The PCR primers were developed as part of a collaboration with the E. coli Genome Group, headed by Dr. Fred Blattner at the Department of Genetics, University of Wisconsin-Madison (http://www.genome.wisc.edu). The array contains 4,290 PCR-amplified ORFs, representing all of the protein-encoding genes.

Sample.Title: E. coli sample 1

Channel.Source: Total RNA from E. coli only control
Channel.Characteristics: Total RNA from pre-incubated E. coli cells
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 1) Grow the Bdellovibrio in a “prey lysate” of 1L Ca/HEPES, 75ml overnight E. coli YT culture and 50ml of a previous lysate in a 2L conical flask with 200rpm shaking in a 29°C incubator. Grow E. coli in 100ml YT in a 250ml flask overnight at 37°C in the shaking incubator. 2) Check that the lysate is fully lysed by microscopy (i.e. that virtually all the E. coli and bdelloplasts are gone and there are lots of motile attack phase bdellovibrios). 3) Pre-warm a benchtop centrifuge at 29°C. 4) When lysate is fully lysed, spin 15,000g for 30 mins. 5) Spin down the E. coli in the benchtop centrifuge in 50ml falcon tubes, 5,000g, 10 mins at 29°C 6) Resuspend 100ml of E. coli in 100ml Ca/HEPES then incubate at 29ºC in a 500ml flask with 200rpm shaking for 3 hours to stabilise expression. 7) Resuspend all of the bdellovibrios in 100ml Ca/HEPES buffer and incubate at 29°C in 500ml conical flask with 200rpm shaking for 3 hours to stabilise expression. 8) After 2.5 hours incubation, remove 35ml from each, spin 5,000g for 5 minutes, filter 3 times through a 0.22µm filter to give supernatant which is returned to incubate at 29°C 9) Pre-label 15ml falcon tubes for the samples and add 1ml Phenol/ethanol solution (5% phenol 95% ethanol, v/v). 10) To start the infection, after 3 hours of pre-incubation, quickly add to the pre-incubated flasks: * the TEST with 25ml E. coli and 25ml bdellovibrios * the S17-1 ONLY with 25ml E. coli and 25ml bdellovibrio supernatant * the BDELLOVIBRIO ONLY with 25ml bdellovibrio and 25ml E. coli supernatant 11) At 15 minutes quickly take 4ml samples from each flask and add them to the phenol/ethanol tubes. Mix tubes well by inversion and put on ice for at least 45mins. 12) After the samples have been on ice for at least 45 minutes, spin 10 mins, 3320g 15) Pour off the supernatant, leaving about 1ml to resuspend pellet carefully and transfer to microcentrifuge tube on ice. 16) Spin 13K 2 mins at 4ºC and then pipette off remaining supernatant carefully. 17) Store the tube containing the pellet at -80°C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: IFR protocol, eluting in 50µl and DNase treating with Ambion DNA-free kit. http://www.ifr.ac.uk/Safety/Microarrays/protocols.html
Channel.Label: 33P dCTP
Channel.Label-Protocol: Add to a 0.5ml tube 4ul E. coli cDNA labeling primers (Sigma), reconstituted in 40ul sterile distilled water and RNA sample made up to 11ul Anneal the primers to the RNA template by heating to 90°C for 2 minutes, then ramp to 42°C over a period of 20 minutes. When the sample reaches 42°C, add 3ul 10X Reverse transcriptase buffer, 1ul 333uM dATP, 1ul 333uM dGTP, 1ul 333uM dTTP, 2ul 20uCi [alpha-33P] dCTP, 2ul AMV reverse transcriptase, final volume 30ul Incubate 42°C for 2-3 hours apply the sample to Bio-Rad Micro Bio-Spin Chromatography Columns for removal of unincorporated radiolabel

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Rinse the arrays in 50ml 2X SSPE for 5 minutes. Drain. Pre-Hybridise the array in 5ml hybridisation solution with 100ug/ml denatured salmon sperm DNA for at least 1 hour at 65°C. Add all labelled cDNA to 3ml hydridisation solution and denature for 10minutes at 95°C, add to array and hybridise overnight at 65°C Decant off hybridisation solution and wash 3 times in 40-50ml wash solution at room temperature Wash 3 times in 80-100ml wash solution at 65°C for 20 minutes Air dry array for 5 minutes Wrap in saran wrap
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Arrays were exposed to Molecular Dynamics phosphor screens for 2 days and scanned at 88um with Molecular Dynamics Phosphorimager 425 running Image Quant software
Sample.Description: Biological replicate 1 of 5, technical replicate 1 of 2
Sample.Data-Processing: The ArayVision software was used to analyse the phosphorimages with the template provided by Sigma Genosys for the arrays. Background correction was by using the area surrounding the template, 2 pixels distance and thickness, and normalisation was against all spots in the array

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 1) Grow the Bdellovibrio in a “prey lysate” of 1L Ca/HEPES, 75ml overnight E. coli YT culture and 50ml of a previous lysate in a 2L conical flask with 200rpm shaking in a 29°C incubator. Grow E. coli in 100ml YT in a 250ml flask overnight at 37°C in the shaking incubator. 2) Check that the lysate is fully lysed by microscopy (i.e. that virtually all the E. coli and bdelloplasts are gone and there are lots of motile attack phase bdellovibrios). 3) Pre-warm a benchtop centrifuge at 29°C. 4) When lysate is fully lysed, spin 15,000g for 30 mins. 5) Spin down the E. coli in the benchtop centrifuge in 50ml falcon tubes, 5,000g, 10 mins at 29°C 6) Resuspend 100ml of E. coli in 100ml Ca/HEPES then incubate at 29ºC in a 500ml flask with 200rpm shaking for 3 hours to stabilise expression. 7) Resuspend all of the bdellovibrios in 100ml Ca/HEPES buffer and incubate at 29°C in 500ml conical flask with 200rpm shaking for 3 hours to stabilise expression. 8) After 2.5 hours incubation, remove 35ml from each, spin 5,000g for 5 minutes, filter 3 times through a 0.22µm filter to give supernatant which is returned to incubate at 29°C 9) Pre-label 15ml falcon tubes for the samples and add 1ml Phenol/ethanol solution (5% phenol 95% ethanol, v/v). 10) To start the infection, after 3 hours of pre-incubation, quickly add to the pre-incubated flasks: * the TEST with 25ml E. coli and 25ml bdellovibrios * the S17-1 ONLY with 25ml E. coli and 25ml bdellovibrio supernatant * the BDELLOVIBRIO ONLY with 25ml bdellovibrio and 25ml E. coli supernatant 11) At 15 minutes quickly take 4ml samples from each flask and add them to the phenol/ethanol tubes. Mix tubes well by inversion and put on ice for at least 45mins. 12) After the samples have been on ice for at least 45 minutes, spin 10 mins, 3320g 15) Pour off the supernatant, leaving about 1ml to resuspend pellet carefully and transfer to microcentrifuge tube on ice. 16) Spin 13K 2 mins at 4ºC and then pipette off remaining supernatant carefully. 17) Store the tube containing the pellet at -80°C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: IFR protocol, eluting in 50µl and DNase treating with Ambion DNA-free kit. http://www.ifr.ac.uk/Safety/Microarrays/protocols.html
Channel.Label: 33P dCTP
Channel.Label-Protocol: Add to a 0.5ml tube 4ul E. coli cDNA labeling primers (Sigma), reconstituted in 40ul sterile distilled water and RNA sample made up to 11ul Anneal the primers to the RNA template by heating to 90°C for 2 minutes, then ramp to 42°C over a period of 20 minutes. When the sample reaches 42°C, add 3ul 10X Reverse transcriptase buffer, 1ul 333uM dATP, 1ul 333uM dGTP, 1ul 333uM dTTP, 2ul 20uCi [alpha-33P] dCTP, 2ul AMV reverse transcriptase, final volume 30ul Incubate 42°C for 2-3 hours apply the sample to Bio-Rad Micro Bio-Spin Chromatography Columns for removal of unincorporated radiolabel

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Rinse the arrays in 50ml 2X SSPE for 5 minutes. Drain. Pre-Hybridise the array in 5ml hybridisation solution with 100ug/ml denatured salmon sperm DNA for at least 1 hour at 65°C. Add all labelled cDNA to 3ml hydridisation solution and denature for 10minutes at 95°C, add to array and hybridise overnight at 65°C Decant off hybridisation solution and wash 3 times in 40-50ml wash solution at room temperature Wash 3 times in 80-100ml wash solution at 65°C for 20 minutes Air dry array for 5 minutes Wrap in saran wrap
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Arrays were exposed to Molecular Dynamics phosphor screens for 2 days and scanned at 88um with Molecular Dynamics Phosphorimager 425 running Image Quant software
Sample.Description: Biological replicate 5 of 5, technical replicate 1 of 2
Sample.Data-Processing: The ArayVision software was used to analyse the phosphorimages with the template provided by Sigma Genosys for the arrays. Background correction was by using the area surrounding the template, 2 pixels distance and thickness, and normalisation was against all spots in the array

Series.Title: Bdellovibrio bacteriovorus infection of E. coli
Series.Summary: The transcriptional response of E. coli being predated by Bdellovibrio bacteriovorus Keywords: Transcriptional analysis
Series.Overall-Design:
5 biological replicates with 2 technical replicates each of E. coli cells only and E. coli cells 15 minutes post-infection arrays 4 arrays, with samples swapped for each biological replicate.
Gel image files generated by the ImageQuant scanning software.
Each raw data txt file has the "control" samples which are the E. coli samples reading on the entire array and thus with the 2 technical replicates, and the "data" samples to which it is compared by Arrayvision. the "data" samples of ec1 to ec5 are Bdellovibrio only controls 2 technical replicates). The "data" samples of t1 to t5 are the test samples. Hence t1 to t5 are the raw data files for samples test1 to test10 and ec1 to ec5 are the raw data files for all of samples ec-1 to ec-10 and bd-1 to bd-10.
